intro: Trichosanthes formosana, commonly known as the Taiwan trumpet vine, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Cucurbitaceae family, which includes cucumbers and gourds. The plant is characterized by its striking yellow flowers and long, slender fruits that mature into orange-red berries. It typically grows as a climbing vine, often found in forested areas. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticulture and ecological studies.
